summary: College daily planning app delivered as a native Android APK (not a mobile-browser web app), with weekly schedule, absence tracking, weekly per-course planned vs spent hours (with unused hours rolling over), and detailed semester reports.
architectural_notes: Project direction change: deliver as a native Android APK (installable), not primarily as a mobile-browser web app.
known_issues: Semester creation fails (user reports 'semester creating failed').

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity-based user flow and ensure all user data is scoped per authenticated principal (create/read/update only within the signed-in userâ€™s dataset).
Build a weekly schedule UI that lets the user view and manage their weekly schedule (by day) and associate schedule items with a course (optional) and/or a category label.
Build absence tracking UI per course, including adding an absence entry (date + optional note) and viewing absence totals within a selected semester.

Build weekly hours tracking UI per course: (a) set planned hours for the week, (b) log time spent entries for the week, and (c) show computed weekly summary including rollover-in, available planned hours, spent hours, and unused hours (rollover-out).
Create a semester reports section with detailed summaries: per-course totals (planned vs spent), weekly breakdowns, absence totals, and rollover effects across the semester weeks.

Add navigation and information architecture for the app: Semester selector/manager, Courses, Weekly Schedule, Weekly Hours, Absences, and Reports, with consistent week/semester selection behavior across pages.
Apply a cohesive visual theme for a college productivity planner (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) consistently across all screens without using a blue/purple primary palette.
Generate and display required static image assets in the frontend at `frontend/public/assets/generated` and use them in the UI where appropriate.
Make the frontend fully usable on Android mobile browsers by ensuring all screens are mobile-responsive, touch-friendly, and do not rely on hover-only interactions.

Fix Android-specific layout issues caused by dense tables/grids by ensuring content is readable and scrollable on small screens (e.g., make long tables horizontally scrollable, and ensure multi-column grids collapse appropriately).

Ensure the Android sign-in experience works reliably with Internet Identity by handling mobile browser constraints (pop-up/redirect behavior) and presenting clear, English user-facing feedback if sign-in cannot be completed due to browser settings.
Add an Android APK packaging target for the existing React frontend so the app can be installed and launched as a native Android app (APK), rather than being used in a mobile browser.
Update Internet Identity sign-in UX and error messaging to reflect an installed Android app context (APK) rather than a mobile browser context, while keeping all user-facing text in English.

Improve semester creation error handling in the Manage page so the user sees a clear English error message that includes the underlying backend failure reason (e.g., Unauthorized vs other failures), instead of only a generic failure toast.

new_feature_requests.summary: Weekly schedule view for college planning
Track total hours spent per course on a weekly basis
Plan total hours to spend per course on a weekly basis
Roll over unused planned hours to the next week

Create core backend data model and CRUD APIs for: semesters, courses (linked to a semester), weekly schedule items, absence records, weekly planned hours per course, and weekly time-spent logs per course.

Implement weekly planned-hours rollover logic: for each course, compute remaining planned hours in a week as (planned - spent); if positive, automatically transfer that unused amount to the next week as additional available planned hours; if negative, do not transfer (no debt) unless explicitly specified in UI as an override.
Ensure the app works well on Android devices (mobile-responsive UI and compatibility testing/support)
Package and deliver the app as a native Android APK (installable app), not a mobile-browser web app

Fix the root cause of semester creation failing for signed-in users by ensuring authenticated principals have the required "user" permission in backend access control before calling semester CRUD methods (createSemester/getSemesters).

projectName: College daily planner with weekly schedule, absence tracking, weekly planned vs spent hours (rollover), and semester reports
